comments.content:
Frequently Asked Questions
📝 Using the NCEA Student Portal (NZQA)1. Go to the Portal Visit the NZQA Student and Learner Login page: https://www.nzqa.govt.nz/login
2. Log InOption A: Education Sector Login (ESL)
  • Used by most students.
  • Requires:
  • NSN (National Student Number) – ask your school if needed
  • Password – set this up if you're logging in for the first time
Option B: RealMe
  • Alternative login (used often by adults or for other government services)

3. Create Your Login (First-Time Users)If you’re new: 1. Click “Register Now” 2. Enter:
  • Your NSN
  • Your date of birth
  • A current email
3. Follow the prompts to verify and create your password

4. Inside the PortalOnce logged in, you can:
  • NCEA Results shows your grades for each standard

  • Record of Achievement (ROA) shows the summary of all credits

  • Vocational Pathways

  • Your progress in practical course tracks

  • University Entrance

  • Status of your UE qualification

  • Literacy & Numeracy

  • Credit counts in these areas

  • Scholarship Results If you enter NZQA Scholarship examinations

  • Exam Timetables

  • Available during exam periods


5. Tips & Troubleshooting
  • ✔️ Keep your email up to date so NZQA can contact you

  • ✔️ Download and print your ROA anytime

  • ❗ If something’s missing or seems incorrect (e.g., wrong credits), contact your school first—they deal directly with NZQA

6. Printable Guide (Optional)
  • Use File → Print or File → Download in Google Docs to create a PDF or printout.
